statements: SELECT * FROM high_value_customers;
SELECT customer_id, recency, frequency, monetary_value FROM high_value_customers;
SELECT customer_id, monetary_value FROM high_value_customers WHERE frequency > 3;
SELECT * FROM high_value_customers ORDER BY monetary_value DESC;
SELECT customer_id, recency FROM high_value_customers WHERE recency < 30;
SELECT * FROM high_value_customers WHERE recency > 30 ORDER BY monetary_value DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT customer_id, frequency, monetary_value FROM high_value_customers WHERE recency < 10 ORDER BY frequency ASC, monetary_value DESC;
SELECT DISTINCT customer_id FROM high_value_customers WHERE recency between 15 and 60 ORDER BY customer_id;
SELECT customer_id, recency, monetary_value FROM high_value_customers WHERE monetary_value >= 1000 ORDER BY recency DESC, customer_id ASC;
SELECT customer_id, recency, frequency, monetary_value FROM high_value_customers WHERE recency < 20 OR monetary_value < 500 ORDER BY recency ASC, frequency DESC;
SELECT customer_id, recency, frequency, monetary_value FROM customers;
SELECT * FROM customer_segments;
SELECT customer_id, monetary_value, frequency, recency FROM customers;
SELECT segment_name, description FROM customer_segments;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY recency ASC, monetary_value DESC
SELECT customer_id, frequency FROM customers WHERE recency > 30
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE frequency BETWEEN 5 AND 10 ORDER BY monetary_value DESC
SELECT customer_id, monetary_value FROM customers WHERE monetary_value > 1000
SELECT segment_name, description FROM customer_segments
SELECT * FROM high_value_customers ORDER BY customer_id DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT customer_id, frequency, recency FROM high_value_customers WHERE frequency > 5
SELECT MAX(recency) AS max_recency FROM high_value_customers
SELECT segment_name FROM customer_segments WHERE segment_id IN (1, 2, 3)
SELECT transaction_id, customer_id, amount, transaction_date FROM transactions ORDER BY transaction_date ASC
SELECT * FROM high_value_customers WHERE recency > 30 ORDER BY monetary_value DESC
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(transaction_id) AS num_transactions FROM transactions GROUP BY customer_id ORDER BY num_transactions DESC
SELECT c.customer_id, c.recency, t.amount FROM high_value_customers c INNER JOIN transactions t ON c.customer_id = t.customer_id WHERE t.amount > 100 ORDER BY c.recency ASC, t.amount DESC
SELECT c.customer_id, c.recency, s.segment_name FROM high_value_customers c JOIN customer_segments s ON c.customer_id = s.segment_id WHERE c.recency < 15 ORDER BY c.recency DESC
SELECT customer_id, SUM(amount) AS total_spent FROM transactions GROUP BY customer_id HAVING total_spent > 5000 ORDER BY total_spent DESC
SELECT * FROM customers
SELECT customer_name, customer_segment FROM customers
SELECT customer_name, r_score, f_score, m_score FROM customers ORDER BY r_score DESC
SELECT * FROM transactions WHERE amount > 1000
SELECT * FROM orders ORDER BY order_date ASC
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_segment = 'Premium';
SELECT customer_name, r_score, f_score, m_score FROM customers WHERE r_score > 80;
SELECT customer_name, amount FROM customers JOIN transactions ON customers.customer_id = transactions.customer_id WHERE amount > 1000;
SELECT customers.customer_name, orders.order_date, orders.total_amount FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id ORDER BY orders.total_amount DESC;

SELECT customers.customer_name, transactions.transaction_date, products.product_name FROM customers JOIN transactions ON customers.customer_id = transactions.customer_id JOIN products ON transactions.amount > products.unit_price ORDER BY transactions.transaction_date ASC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_id, recency FROM customers ORDER BY recency DESC;
SELECT product_name, unit_price FROM products WHERE unit_price > 50;
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(order_id) AS order_count FROM orders GROUP BY customer_id;

SELECT customers.customer_id, customers.recency, customer_segments.segment_name FROM customers JOIN segment_customers ON customers.customer_id = segment_customers.customer_id JOIN customer_segments ON segment_customers.segment_id = customer_segments.segment_id;
SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY recency DESC, monetary_value ASC LIMIT 5;

SELECT segment_name, COUNT(customer_id) as total_customers FROM customer_segments INNER JOIN segment_customers ON customer_segments.segment_id = segment_customers.segment_id GROUP BY segment_name ORDER BY total_customers DESC;
SELECT product_name, unit_price FROM products WHERE unit_price > 50 ORDER BY unit_price DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT customer_id, order_date, total_amount FROM orders WHERE order_date BETWEEN '2021-01-01' AND '2021-06-30' ORDER BY total_amount DESC LIMIT 3;

SELECT segment_name, AVG(recency) as avg_recency, AVG(frequency) as avg_frequency, AVG(monetary_value) as avg_monetary_value FROM customer_segments INNER JOIN segment_customers ON customer_segments.segment_id = segment_customers.segment_id INNER JOIN customers ON segment_customers.customer_id = customers.customer_id GROUP BY segment_name;
